headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Send JSON object to use the API Web Services

headers.name: X-chkp-sid
headers.description: Session unique identifier as it returned by the login request

body.name: from-date
body.description: The date from which tracking changes is to be performed. ISO 8601. If timezone isn't specified in the input, the Management server's timezone is used.

body.name: from-session
body.description: The session UID from which tracking changes is to be performed.

body.name: limit
body.description: Maximum number of sessions to analyze.

body.name: offset
body.description: Number of sessions to skip (beginning with from-session).

body.name: to-date
body.description: The date until which tracking changes is to be performed. ISO 8601. If timezone isn't specified in the input, the Management server's timezone is used.

body.name: to-session
body.description: The session UID until which tracking changes is to be performed.

success.name: task-id
success.description: Diff task UID. Use show-task command to check the progress of the task.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

show-changes between the dates.description: Request for changes by start and end date. Use the show-task command to check the progress of the task. Output below is the output of the show-task command.

show-changes by session identifiers.description: Request for changes by start session and end session. Use the show-task command to check the progress of the task. Output below is the output of the show-task command.
